subject: Empire State Building (NYC)
lead_paragraph: In separate races Tuesday, 160 men and 64 women will sprint from the lobby of the Empire State Building to the 86th-floor observation deck in the 31st annual Empire State Building Run-Up, covering 1,576 steps along the way. “I run it just for fun,” said Suzy Walsham, a world-class runner in the 800 and 1,500 meters who won last year’s women’s race. “But it’s not that much fun while I’m running it. But once you get to the top, it’s an amazing view.”Thomas Dold, a 23-year-old economics student from Germany, is the defending men’s champion.
